57dc5c5f-fb6f-4b3c-a7aa-c44b7b0aaaf4.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated practical knowledge of software testing's fundamental concepts. They are now able to use a common language for efficient and effective communication, autonomously analyze and prioritize functional and non-functional specifications, as well as interpret and execute necessary tests. Earners also understand established concepts and fundamental test processes. Holders of this badge are eligible to continue on to higher level software testing qualifications.
57dc5c5f-fb6f-4b3c-a7aa-c44b7b0aaaf4.name: ISTQB® Certified Tester Foundation Level (CTFL)

714ba101-5a17-4b47-814f-6f72aafde926.description: Earners of the ISTQB® CTFL-AT badge have demonstrated they can collaborate in a cross-functional Agile team being familiar with principles and basic practices of Agile software development. They are able to adapt existing testing experience and knowledge to Agile values and principles and support the Agile team in planning test-related activities. They can also apply relevant methods and techniques for testing in an Agile project and assist the Agile team in test automation activities.
714ba101-5a17-4b47-814f-6f72aafde926.name: ISTQB® Certified Tester Foundation Level - Agile Tester (CTFL-AT)

a7d5fb4e-7a3b-4957-b54f-de554ece5119.description: Holders of this badge are able to assist in adaptation of current test automation processes for web application test automation, and adapt existing testing & test automation experience and knowledge to develop automated tests for web applications using Selenium. 0e61e1f9-c5c9-4894-8744-4e55b4439498.description: Earners of the ISTQB® CTAL-TM badge have demonstrated that they can manage a testing project by implementing the mission, goals and testing processes established for the testing organization. They are also able to create and implement test plans consistent with organizational policies and test strategies.

The CU Certified Cloud Testing - Foundation Level certification course focuses on essential cloud characteristics and cloud specific tests that a tester needs to know.

1a48e1a3-1d1e-47b0-9601-3ae85d0619e1.description: The Certified Function Point Specialist (CFPS) designation recognizes the knowledge and skill at applying the IFPUG FPA rules. The CFPS requires that the candidate has a minimum of 90% overall on the exam and a minimum of 80% in each of the three sections: Definition, Implementation and Case Study.
1a48e1a3-1d1e-47b0-9601-3ae85d0619e1.name: IFPUG™ Certified Function Point Specialist (CFPS)

alignments.name: IFPUG Counting Practices Manual (CPM) - Version 4.3.1
alignments.description: IFPUG owns Function Point Analysis (FPA) as defined in ISO standard 20296:2009 which specifies the definitions, rules and steps for applying the IFPUG's functional size measurement (FSM) method.

badge_template_activities.title: Experience and knowledge in Functional Point Analysis (FPA)

The IFPUG™ CFPS designation indicates that the accredited individual, by passing a rigorous exam and achieving a score of 90% or better, has mastered the fundamentals of Function Point Analysis at a significant depth and breadth in applying the Function Point Analysis rules.
In order to hold an IFPUG™ Certification, you must have a valid IFPUG corporate or individual membership.

170207ad-01ea-4e08-9b4a-21d4779e971a.description: Holders of this badge understand what DevOps is, how it fits in various SDLCs and the usefulness of cloud technology in reference to DevOps. They also have a good grasp of various tools in DevOps and how to apply some like Dockers, Jenkins, Puppet-Chef/Ansible, Nagios, Selenium, Git/GitHub etc.

8b13e744-e7af-47cc-8fde-26709827ac3b.description: The Certified SNAP Specialist (CSS) designations recognize the highest level of knowledge and skills in the Software Non-functional Assessment Process (SNAP). IFPUG has currently two levels of Certifications related to SNAP – Certified SNAP Practitioner (CSP) and Certified SNAP Specialist (CSS).

0a66b76c-368c-491b-b008-f35c08297620.description: The Certified Function Point Specialist (CFPS) extension designation recognizes the knowledge and skill at applying the IFPUG FPA rules for candidate who have previously passed the exam and fulfilled specific criteria to extend certification status for up to 3 more years.
0a66b76c-368c-491b-b008-f35c08297620.name: IFPUG™ Certified Function Point Specialist - Extension Designation

alignments.name: DIN EN ISO/IEC 17024: 2012

alignments.name: IFPUG Counting Practices Manual (CPM) - Version 4.3.1
alignments.description: IFPUG owns Function Point Analysis (FPA) as defined in ISO standard 20296:2009 which specifies the definitions, rules and steps for applying the IFPUG's functional size measurement (FSM) method.

badge_template_activities.title: Experience and knowledge in Functional Point Analysis (FPA).

The IFPUG™ CFPS designation indicates that the accredited individual, by passing a rigorous exam and achieving a score of 90% or better, has mastered the fundamentals of Function Point Analysis at a significant depth and breadth in applying the Function Point Analysis rules.
In order to hold an IFPUG™ Certification, you must have a valid IFPUG corporate or individual membership.

Individuals may extend their current level of CFPS certification for up to three (3) years in one (1) year increments by completing multiple occurrences within a given Activity Category with a minimum of one (1) and a maximum of three (3) occurrences. The CFPS Certification Extension program is under the jurisdiction of the IFPUG Certification Committee, with oversight provided by the IFPUG Board of Directors (BOD).

4f0d9033-af6b-43ba-82b3-88315997ba30.description: The Certified Function Point Specialist (CFPS) - Fellow Designation recognizes the knowledge and skill at applying the IFPUG FPA rules for more than 20 years.
4f0d9033-af6b-43ba-82b3-88315997ba30.name: IFPUG™ Certified Function Point Specialist - Fellow Designation

alignments.name: DIN EN ISO/IEC 17024: 2012
alignments.description: Brightest's processes are aligned to the global standard ISO/IEC 17024: 2012.

alignments.name: IFPUG Counting Practices Manual (CPM) - Version 4.3.1
alignments.description: IFPUG owns Function Point Analysis (FPA) as defined in ISO standard 20296:2009 which specifies the definitions, rules and steps for applying the IFPUG's functional size measurement (FSM) method.

badge_template_activities.title: Experience and knowledge in Functional Point Analysis (FPA)

The IFPUG™ CFPS designation indicates that the accredited individual, by passing a rigorous exam and achieving a score of 90% or better, has mastered the fundamentals of Function Point Analysis at a significant depth and breadth in applying the Function Point Analysis rules.
In order to hold an IFPUG™ Certification, you must have a valid IFPUG corporate or individual membership.
In order to receive this IFPUG™ CFPS Fellow Designation, the candidate must have maintained the Certified Function Point Specialist (CFPS) level of certification for 20 or more ceonsecutive years.
